body_html: Sorry, I forgot to post my results for TF 1.6 but as you can see the imaginary part of the first entry is still non-zero in TF 1.6. In general the error using power of two inputs are smaller than non power of two's. If thats an issue in the cuFFT implementation one should mention it in the tf.fft() function description? So everybody would know this issue.

body: Sorry, I forgot to post my results for TF 1.6 but as you can see the imaginary part of the first entry is still non-zero in TF 1.6. In general the error using power of two inputs are smaller than non power of two's. If thats an issue in the cuFFT implementation one should mention it in the tf.fft() function description? So everybody would know this issue.
